intro: Chilita lasiacantha, commonly known as the woolly chilita, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, pale pink to white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in grasslands and shrublands. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, wind-dispersed seeds. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
